result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Maloney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Submit DNA sample.  Attend sex offender treatment/counseling.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on 9-16-16 filed by court reporter Chris Champeau

Defendant Thomas J Maloney in court, in custody with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF389, 14CF161, and 15CF508. 14CF161 will remain in DPA status.  In 15CF508 Rights/Elements. Defendant pled no contest to Cts. 1 & 2. Court found guilty. Judgment was entered. Cts. 3 & 4 Dismissed and read in. Court sentenced defendant on Ct. 1 Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 days in jail, with Huber, consecutive to any other sentence. $453.00 costs. Ct. 2 5 days jail, with Huber, consecutive to Ct. 1.  $253.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample. 15CF389 Dismissed and read in.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

ADA Clifford Burdon appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person in custody with Atty Roger Klopp.  Motion to Revoke Deferred Proscution Agreement by ADA Burdon.  Atty Klopp motioned court to proceed today for sentencing today.  Revocation Warrant and Order received.  Court will set revocation of Deferred Prosecution Agreement for different hearing.  Court denies converting cash bond to signature bond as not relevant.  Court will proceed today on sentencing.  Sentence credit 250 days agreed upon by parties.  Counsel gives recommendations.  No statement by defendant.  Court imposed 18 months initial confinement and 24 month extended supervision.  Condition of extended supervison:  no contact with victim.  Victim rights have been complied with.

Defendant Thomas J Maloney in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed adding Ct. 2.  Reading was waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Cts. 1 & 2.  Court found guilty of Ct. 2.  On Ct. 1 Court withheld adjudication and approved and entered into 36 month DPA, concurrent to Ct. 2 probation.  Ct. 2 Court entered judgment.  Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  Attend sex offender treatment/counseling.  No jail credit due.
